001package net.tvburger.jdl.model;
002
003import java.util.Map;
004
005/**
006 * Interface for components that expose tunable hyperparameters.
007 * <p>
008 * Hyperparameters are configuration values that control the behavior of a model
009 * or algorithm (e.g., learning rate, momentum, batch size) but are not learned
010 * directly from data. This interface provides a generic mechanism to inspect
011 * and update such values at runtime.
012 */
013public interface HyperparameterConfigurable {
014
015    default boolean hasHyperparameter(String name) {
016        return getHyperparameters().containsKey(name);
017    }
018
019    /**
020     * Returns a snapshot of all current hyperparameters.
021     * <p>
022     * The returned map should contain stable, human-readable keys (such as
023     * {@code "learningRate"} or {@code "momentum"}) mapped to their current values.
024     * Implementations are encouraged to return a defensive copy so that external
025     * modifications do not affect the internal state.
026     *
027     * @return an immutable or defensive copy of the current hyperparameters
028     */
029    Map<String, Object> getHyperparameters();
030
031    /**
032     * Returns the value of a single hyperparameter by name.
033     * <p>
034     * This is a convenience method that queries {@link #getHyperparameters()}.
035     * If the name is not present, this will return {@code null}.
036     *
037     * @param name the hyperparameter name
038     * @return the hyperparameter value, or {@code null} if not defined
039     */
040    default Object getHyperparameter(String name) {
041        return getHyperparameters().get(name);
042    }
043
044    /**
045     * Returns the value of a single hyperparameter by name, cast to the expected type.
046     * <p>
047     * This is a convenience method that queries {@link #getHyperparameters()} and
048     * casts the result to the requested type.
049     * If the name is not present, this will return {@code null}.
050     * If the value is present but not of the expected type, a {@link ClassCastException}
051     * will be thrown.
052     *
053     * @param name                    the hyperparameter name
054     * @param hyperparameterTypeClass the expected type of the value
055     * @param <T>                     the type parameter corresponding to the expected value type
056     * @return the hyperparameter value cast to the requested type, or {@code null} if not defined
057     * @throws ClassCastException if the value cannot be cast to the given type
058     */
059    default <T> T getHyperparameter(String name, Class<T> hyperparameterTypeClass) {
060        return hyperparameterTypeClass.cast(getHyperparameters().get(name));
061    }
062
063    /**
064     * Updates multiple hyperparameters at once by name.
065     * <p>
066     * Implementations should validate the input and either:
067     * <ul>
068     *   <li>ignore unknown keys, or</li>
069     *   <li>throw an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if an unrecognized
070     *       hyperparameter is provided.</li>
071     * </ul>
072     *
073     * @param hyperparameters a map of hyperparameter names to new values
074     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if any value is invalid or a key is unrecognized
075     */
076    default void setHyperparameters(Map<String, Object> hyperparameters) {
077        hyperparameters.forEach(this::setHyperparameter);
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Updates a single hyperparameter by name.
082     *
083     * @param name  the hyperparameter name
084     * @param value the new hyperparameter value
085     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the name is unrecognized or the value is invalid
086     */
087    void setHyperparameter(String name, Object value);
088
089}
